prompt: How do I brew a good pour-over coffee at home?
chosen: Use a 1:15 coffee-to-water ratio, 92–96°C water, rinse filter, bloom 30–45 s with ~2× dose, then pour in slow circles to finish around 2:30–3:00; grind medium-fine.
rejected: Just boil water and pour it over pre-ground coffee until the mug is full; timing and grind size don’t matter.
